title: `x` dropped because it borrows itself + dropping a reference causes an error

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.

If you cannot produce a minimal reproduction case (something that would work in
isolation), please provide the steps or even link to a repository that causes
the problematic output to occur.
-->

This file produces a very strange error message on build: https://github.com/Jakobeha/typed-arena-any-vec/blob/weird-issue/src/test.rs

```
error[E0597]: `arena` does not live long enough
  --> typed-arena-any-vec/src/test.rs:30:24
   |
30 |         let mut node = arena.alloc(Node(None, 1, DropTracker(&drop_counter))).unwrap();
   |                        ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ borrowed value does not live long enough
...
47 |     }
   |     -
   |     |
   |     `arena` dropped here while still borrowed
   |     borrow might be used here, when `arena` is dropped and runs the destructor for type `Arena<Node<'_, '_>, ArrayVec<Node<'_, '_>, 2_usize>>`
```

additionally when I try to drop a reference I get

```
error[E0505]: cannot move out of `node` because it is borrowed
  --> typed-arena-any-vec/src/test.rs:46:14
   |
38 |         let error = arena.alloc(Node(Some(node), 3, DropTracker(&drop_counter))).unwrap_err();
   |                                           ---- borrow of `*node` occurs here
...
46 |         drop(node);
   |              ^^^^ move out of `node` occurs here
47 |     }
   |     - borrow might be used here, when `arena` is dropped and runs the destructor for type `Arena<Node<'_, '_>, ArrayVec<Node<'_, '_>, 2_usize>>`
```

but I dropped the *reference* to node, IntelliJ even warns on line 46 "Dropping a reference does nothing".

This seems like a rustc bug considering dropping the reference causes an error. Although I don't know if my code has any actual "dropped while borrowed" problem.

The issue came up when I implemented `Drop` on `_ArrayVec` which is stored within `Arena`. Removing the `impl Drop for _ArrayVec` resolves the first compiler error (but leaks memory), however *dropping a reference still causes the second error*. Removing the reference drop causes the code to compile and tests to run normally, there are test failures but no segfaults.

Note that `Arena<Node<...` does *not* have drop code from `DropTracker` because it is wrapped in `ManuallyDrop`. Only when `Drop` is implemented on `_ArrayVec` does it get the drop restriction.

Also note that this was tested on the nightly compiler 1.64.
